title: 3 Effective Ways to Rickroll Anyone Online

steps.title: Find a Rickroll video link.
steps.content: Find a Rickroll video link. The most popular option is the official music video on YouTube , but you can use any version of the video, as long as it has the same contents. Official music video : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dQw4w9WgXcQ

steps.title: Go to https://tinyurl.com/app in a web browser.
steps.content: Go to https://tinyurl.com/app in a web browser. This is a popular site used to shorten long URLs into shorter ones. This can hide the link to the Rickroll video, which makes it easier to fool others into clicking it.

steps.title: Copy and paste
steps.content: Copy and paste the link into the URL field. Highlight the URL and press CTRL + C (Windows) or CMD + C (Mac) to copy. Click the field in TinyURL and press CTRL + V (Windows) or CMD + V (Mac) to paste the link. Be sure to check the box above the green button to agree to TinyURL's Terms of Service.

steps.title: Click Shorten URL.
steps.content: Click Shorten URL . This is the green button at the bottom. Your new URL will be made.

steps.title: Click Copy.
steps.content: Click Copy . This is the green button with the two squares. You can also use TinyURL to Rickroll someone using a QR Code .

steps.title: Share the shortened link.
steps.content: Share the shortened link. The link is copied to your device's clipboard. You can now paste it into a social media website or app such as Facebook Messenger , Discord , Instagram, or another app. When the recipient clicks the link, they'll be Rickrolled.

steps.title: Find a Rickroll video link.
steps.content: Find a Rickroll video link. The most popular option is the official music video on YouTube, but you can use any version of the video, as long as it has the same contents. Official music video : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dQw4w9WgXcQ

steps.title: Go to https://tinyurl.com/app in a web browser.
steps.content: Go to https://tinyurl.com/app in a web browser. This is a popular site used to shorten long URLs into shorter ones. This can hide the link to the Rickroll video, which makes it easier to fool others into clicking it.

steps.title: Copy and paste the link into the URL field.
steps.content: Copy and paste the link into the URL field. Highlight the URL and press CTRL + C (Windows) or CMD + C (Mac) to copy. Click the field in TinyURL and press CTRL + V (Windows) or CMD + V (Mac) to paste the link. Be sure to check the box above the green button to agree to TinyURL's Terms of Service.

steps.title: Click Shorten URL.
steps.content: Click Shorten URL . This is the green button at the bottom. Your new URL will be made.

steps.title: Click QR Code.
steps.content: Click QR Code . This is the blue button with four squares.

steps.title: Click a download option.
steps.content: Click a download option. Select between SVG , PNG , or PNG 1200 . For simple usage, you can select PNG . This downloads the QR code to your device.

steps.title: Share the QR code.
steps.content: Share the QR code. Now that you have the QR code image, you can send it to the recipient. You can put the image in a text, an email , or even print it out. Keep in mind the recipient will need to know how to scan a QR code , but most modern smartphones have the capability built-in. When the recipient opens the link, they'll be Rickrolled.

steps.title: Find a Rickroll video link.
steps.content: Find a Rickroll video link. The most popular option is the official music video on YouTube, but you can use any version of the video, as long as it has the same contents. [1] X Research source Official music video : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dQw4w9WgXcQ

steps.title: Compose a new email.
steps.content: Compose a new email. Log into your email provider's website or app and start a new email. Be sure to address it to the recipient.

steps.title: Click the "Insert link" icon.
steps.content: Click the "Insert link" icon. The icon may vary depending on your email provider, but this should look like a chain or link. When you click it, you'll have the option to link to a web address .

steps.title: Copy and paste the link into the URL field.
steps.content: Copy and paste the link into the URL field. In Gmail, this will be the Web address field.

steps.title: Edit the display text.
steps.content: Edit the display text. In Gmail, use the Text to display field. Insert an unassuming title that won't give away your Rickrolling intentions. For example, if you're emailing a friend about a movie, label the link as the movie's trailer. Be sure to click OK to add the link to your email.

steps.title: Send the email.
steps.content: Send the email. This should be a large button at the bottom of your email draft. When the recipient opens the email and clicks the link, they'll be Rickrolled.
